metadata.title: CVE-2017-11721 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
Buffer overflow in ioquake3 before 2017-08-02 allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (application crash) or possibly have unspecified other impact via a crafted packet.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2017-11721` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ioquake3 - 1.36+u20170803+dfsg1-1
ioquake3-server - 1.36+u20170803+dfsg1-1
No subscription required

rtcw - 1.51+dfsg1-3
rtcw-common - 1.51+dfsg1-3
rtcw-server - 1.51+dfsg1-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ioquake3 package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.36+u20170803+dfsg1-1').
iortcw package in impish, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '1.51+dfsg1-3').
